summary: The bill, titled Hammers' Law, amends U.S. Code Title 46 Section 30307 concerning limitations of damages. It focuses on cruise ship voyages, defining "cruise ship" and "nonpecuniary damages." The bill authorizes nonpecuniary damages (loss of care, comfort, and companionship) in legal actions stemming from cruise ship voyages on the high seas, similar to existing provisions for commercial aviation accidents.
